results.title: The Daylight moon: a film about the poet Les Murray
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Don Featherstone Productions
results.brief_description: If there were such a thing, Les Murray would be the Poet Laureate of Australia. In this amusing, lyrical documentary, Don Featherstone has succeeded in capturing the essence of one of our finest poets, a man totally at home in the country round Bunyah N.S.W., farming for a living and writing poems. Interviews with the endearing Les Murray are interspersed with readings of his poems set to suitably beautiful images of the area and people which inspired them. Winner of the Gold Plaque, Chicago International Film Festival 1991.

results.title: The Dawn of Happiness
results.brief_description: A country as enigmatic as any in the Orient is the location for this adventure trip of a lifetime, where we see first hand the roots of modern Thailand. Starting in Bangkok, travel north upstream to Aeutia in the Chao Phraya River in search of the incredible Hill tribes of Northern Thailand, who are found in one of the most remote areas in the country between the borders of Burma and Laos. Upon arrival witness a wedding ceremony - a magnificent display of clothing and jewellery, highlighting the fascinating rituals and traditions of these ancient people. Further on the journey, visit Naoon Suan - one of the largest rice markets in the world, along with Subotai and Chiang Mai, two of the most fascinating cities in Thailand.

results.title: The Darra dogs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Tupicoff and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Haunted by the dogs of his childhood, Dennis Tupicoff tries to explain his feelings about dogs to his young daughter. With the use of a strong animation style Tupicoff tells the story of his youth in Darra, then an industrial suburb of Brisbane, where every household seemed to have a dog. Some dogs were friends that shared their lives and then sadly disappeared or were victims of early deaths as a result of disease or cars. Others were huge and savage and seemed to stalk through their days spreading fear as they lived long and dangerous lives. This is a memorial film to the terrors of childhood, the insecurities, the sadness of death and loss, and to the dogs themselves.

results.title: The Danish village church
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm and Preben Frank Film
results.brief_description: A history of Danish village churches and their architecture. The first churches were built of wood, but none survive in Denmark. In the 12th century stone was used; buildings were in a simple Romanesque style. Frescoes, telling Bible stories or legends of saints were used to decorate the interiors. In the 13th century bigger, more elaborate churches appeared in Gothic styles. Brick was used as a building material, particularly for additions to earlier churches. Changes at the reformation were not violent; seats became more common, since sermons were longer. Churches remain a centre of secular as well as religious life for peasants. Architectural history is briefly summarised. Supervised by Carl Th. Dreyer, Victor Herman, Bernhard Jensen, H. Longborg-Jensen.

results.title: The Dancing lion: an African folktale
results.creator_credit: Tommy McClelland, George Lindsay and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Musicologist Andrew Tracy and a group of African musicians introduce African rhythms and demonstrate how each of the twelve beats sounds alone, in combination and in crossed rhythms. Tracy tells a group of children a folktale about how a husband and a rabbit enchant a lion with music, changing a dinner-hunting beast into “the dancing lion” and thus freeing the wife. He illustrates the role of music in African storytelling by having children clap and chant responses as he relates the tale of a dancing lion.

results.title: The Damnation of Faust; Old King Cole
results.creator_credit: British Instructional Films and Pathe Pictures
results.brief_description: Part of the Classical Music Series, the Bournemouth Municipal Symphony Orchestra performs Berlioz’ s “The Damnation of Faust” and H. Baynton-Power’s “Old King Cole”, conducted by Richard Austin.

results.title: The Daily Show
results.brief_description: During the time of the protests, many late night TV shows reported on the protests, including The Daily Show while Jon Stewart was host. During the segment, Samantha Bee took a humourous approach and satirised participants.

constellations_other.name: Fight for your right
constellations_other.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.title: The CV workout
results.brief_description: Using three case studies, this program looks at producing the best CV to attract an interview. Identifying the right sort of CV to get an interview is an important skill. The three types of CV’s, functional, chronological and targeted with emphasis on selecting the best language and layout are linked to the case studies for more relevance. Accompanied by a Discussion Guide.

results.title: The Cutting edge
results.brief_description: This program shows us the vital search for mineral deposits. We have to mine deeper, in an environment as alien and hostile as space. We are taken possibly the deepest that cameras have ever filmed - capturing a strange world of machines that mine without explosives, that process rock underground, lifting only valuable payload to the surface. Above ground is a new breed of technology, extracting every mineral particle for the least energy consumption.

results.title: The Curtain pole
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: The lengths a man has to go to just to replace a broken curtain pole and the chaos and mayhem he causes is something to be believed in this farcical slapstick comedy. Cast includes Mack Sennett, Harry Solter, Florence Lawrence, Linda Arvidson, Arthur V. Johnson. Silent film with English intertitles.
